\chapter{Requirements}
\label{\detokenize{index:requirements}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] This project uses an external program, called Freeling, to process language : \sphinxurl{http://nlp.lsi.upc.edu/freeling/}
\item[] Check this page to install Freeling on your computer : \sphinxurl{https://talp-upc.gitbooks.io/freeling-4-1-user-manual/content/installation/apis-linux.html}
\item[] Notice that to use Python API, Freeling needs to be installed from source with the dedicated options as described in documentation.
\item[] \sphinxstylestrong{For now}, only a Linux installation in the default folder \sphinxstyleemphasis{/usr/local} is supported, but this should be fixed in next improvements.
\end{DUlineblock}

\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] This project also use an embedded sqlite3 database to store results : \sphinxurl{https://docs.python.org/3/library/sqlite3.html}
\item[] The corresponding Python package should already be installed in your Python3 distribution.
\end{DUlineblock}

\index{compute\_freeling\_sentence() (loacore.classes.classes.Sentence method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence.compute_freeling_sentence}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_freeling\_sentence}}}{}{}~\begin{quote}

Generates a basic \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyfreeling.sentence}} instance, converting \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{words}} as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyfreeling.word}} .
\end{quote}

This function is used to process {\hyperref[\detokenize{index:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}} with Freeling.
\begin{quote}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Load {\hyperref[\detokenize{index:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}} s from database and convert them into Freeling Sentences.

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{loacore}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{load}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{sentence\PYGZus{}load} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n+nn}{sentence\PYGZus{}load}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{sentences} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sentence\PYGZus{}load}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{load\PYGZus{}sentences}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{freeling\PYGZus{}sentences} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{compute\PYGZus{}freeling\PYGZus{}sentence}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{s} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{sentences}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item[{return}] \leavevmode
generated Freeling Sentence instance

\item[{rtype}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyfreeling.sentence}}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\end{itemize}

\index{compute\_freeling\_word() (loacore.classes.classes.Word method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.classes.classes.Word.compute_freeling_word}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_freeling\_word}}}{}{}
Generates a basic \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyfreeling.word}} instance, generated by only the word form, even if some analysis
could have already been realized.

Moreover, only \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.classes.classes.File.load\_sentence()}} (that itself uses this function) should be used,
because all Freeling analysis work with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyfreeling.sentence}} instances.

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}



\section{Synset}
\label{\detokenize{index:synset}}\index{Synset (class in loacore.classes.classes)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.classes.classes.Synset}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.classes.classes.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Synset}}}{\emph{id\_synset}, \emph{id\_word}, \emph{synset\_code}, \emph{synset\_name}, \emph{neg\_score}, \emph{pos\_score}, \emph{obj\_score}}{}~\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Variables}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{id\_synset}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} ID\_Synset used in Synset table

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{id\_word}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} SQL reference to the corresponding Word

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{synset\_code}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} Synset as represented in Freeling (ex : 01123148-a)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{synset\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} Synset as represent in WordNet and SentiWordNet (ex : good.a.01)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{neg\_score}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Negative polarity from SentiWordNet.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pos\_score}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Positive polarity from SentiWordNet.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{obj\_score}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Objective polarity from SentiWordNet.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
neg\_score + pos\_score + obj\_score = 1
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{Feeding database : \sphinxstyleemphasis{process} package}
\label{\detokenize{index:feeding-database-process-package}}
This package contains all the necessary modules to perform the processes of new files. Notice that all those processes are automatically handled by the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.


\section{Raw Processes}
\label{\detokenize{index:raw-processes}}

\subsection{Normalization and review splitting}
\label{\detokenize{index:normalization-and-review-splitting}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Normalization : conversion to UTF-8 and lower case

\item {} 
Review splitting : the file text is splitted into reviews

\end{itemize}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:module-loacore.process.review_process}}\index{loacore.process.review\_process (module)}\index{add\_reviews\_from\_files() (in module loacore.process.review\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.process.review_process.add_reviews_from_files}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.review\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_reviews\_from\_files}}}{\emph{files}}{}
Load argument files from file system and normalize their content.

Compute Reviews objects and add them to the database.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}) \textendash{} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}} s to process

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
added \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}} s

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{normalize() (in module loacore.process.review\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.process.review_process.normalize}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.review\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{normalize}}}{\emph{text}}{}
Performs raw text normalization.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Convertion to lower case

\item {} 
Review splitting using python regular expressions : each new line correspond to a new review

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{text}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} text to process

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
reviews

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{string}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{Freeling Processes}
\label{\detokenize{index:freeling-processes}}

\subsection{tokenization}
\label{\detokenize{index:module-loacore.process.sentence_process}}\label{\detokenize{index:tokenization}}\index{loacore.process.sentence\_process (module)}\index{add\_sentences\_from\_reviews() (in module loacore.process.sentence\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.process.sentence_process.add_sentences_from_reviews}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.sentence\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_sentences\_from\_reviews}}}{\emph{reviews}}{}
Performs the first Freeling process applied to each normalized review.

Each review is tokenized, and then splitted into sentences, thanks to corresponding Freeling modules.

A representation of the Sentences and their Words (tokens) are then added to corresponding tables.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{reviews}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}) \textendash{} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}} s to process

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
added \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{lemmatization}
\label{\detokenize{index:module-loacore.process.lemma_process}}\label{\detokenize{index:lemmatization}}\index{loacore.process.lemma\_process (module)}\index{add\_lemmas\_to\_sentences() (in module loacore.process.lemma\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.process.lemma_process.add_lemmas_to_sentences}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.lemma\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_lemmas\_to\_sentences}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{print\_lemmas=False}}{}
Performs a Freeling process to add lemmas to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Word}} s.

However, the argument is actually a sentence to better fit Freeling usage.

Our \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s will be converted to a Freeling Sentences before processing.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}) \textendash{} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{print\_lemmas}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If True, print lemmatization results

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{disambiguation}
\label{\detokenize{index:module-loacore.process.synset_process}}\label{\detokenize{index:disambiguation}}\index{loacore.process.synset\_process (module)}\index{add\_polarity\_to\_synsets() (in module loacore.process.synset\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.process.synset_process.add_polarity_to_synsets}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.synset\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_polarity\_to\_synsets}}}{}{}
Adds the positive/negative/objective polarities of all the synsets currently in the table
Synset, from the SentiWordNet corpus.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{add\_synsets\_to\_sentences() (in module loacore.process.synset\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.process.synset_process.add_synsets_to_sentences}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.synset\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_synsets\_to\_sentences}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{print\_synsets=False}}{}
Performs a Freeling process to disambiguate words of the sentences according to their context
(UKB algorithm) linking them to a unique synset (if possible).

Our \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s are converted to Freeling Sentences before processing.

Notice that even if we may have already computed the Lemmas for example, Freeling Sentences generated from our
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s are “raw sentences”, without any analysis linked to their Words. So we make all the Freeling
process from scratch every time, except \sphinxstyleemphasis{tokenization} and \sphinxstyleemphasis{sentence splitting}, to avoid any confusion.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the file\_process.add\_files() function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}) \textendash{} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{print\_synsets}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If True, print disambiguation results

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{dependency tree generation}
\label{\detokenize{index:module-loacore.process.deptree_process}}\label{\detokenize{index:dependency-tree-generation}}\index{loacore.process.deptree\_process (module)}\index{add\_dep\_tree\_from\_sentences() (in module loacore.process.deptree\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.process.deptree_process.add_dep_tree_from_sentences}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.deptree\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_dep\_tree\_from\_sentences}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{print\_result=False}}{}
Generates the dependency trees of the specified \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s and add the results to the
database.

Sentences are firstly converted into “raw” Freeling sentences (without any analysis) and then all the necessary
Freeling processes are performed.

The PoS\_tag of words are also computed and added to the database in this function.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This process can be quite long. (at least a few minutes)
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}) \textendash{} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{print\_result}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Print PoS\_tags and labels associated to each \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Word}}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{Load data from database : \sphinxstyleemphasis{load} package}
\label{\detokenize{index:load-data-from-database-load-package}}

\section{Load Files}
\label{\detokenize{index:module-loacore.load.file_load}}\label{\detokenize{index:load-files}}\index{loacore.load.file\_load (module)}\index{clean\_db() (in module loacore.load.file\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.load.file_load.clean_db}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.load.file\_load.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{clean\_db}}}{}{}
Remove all files from database. Implemented references will also engender the deletion of all files
dependencies in database : all the tables will be emptied.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{load\_database() (in module loacore.load.file\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.load.file_load.load_database}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.load.file\_load.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{load\_database}}}{\emph{id\_files={[}{]}}, \emph{load\_reviews=True}, \emph{load\_sentences=True}, \emph{load\_words=True}, \emph{load\_deptrees=True}}{}
Load the complete database as a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}} , with all the dependencies specified in parameters
loaded in them.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{id\_files}} \textendash{} If specified, load only the files with the corresponding ids. Otherwise, load all the files.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_reviews}} \textendash{} Specify if Reviews need to be loaded if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}} s.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_sentences}} \textendash{} If Reviews have been loaded, specify if Sentences need to be loaded in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}} s.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_words}} \textendash{} If Sentences have been loaded, specify if Words need to be loaded in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_deptrees}} \textendash{} If Words have been loaded, specify if DepTrees need to be loaded in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
loaded files

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Among the dependencies, only the load\_deptrees should be set to False to significantly reduce processing
time if they are not needed. Loading other structures is quite fast.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Load files 1,2,3 with only their \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{id\_file}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{id\_path}}.

\section{Load Reviews}
\label{\detokenize{index:module-loacore.load.review_load}}\label{\detokenize{index:load-reviews}}\index{loacore.load.review\_load (module)}\index{load\_reviews() (in module loacore.load.review\_load)}

\index{load\_reviews\_by\_id\_files() (in module loacore.load.review\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Load reviews from the first file as “raw” reviews, without \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s.

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%

\index{load\_reviews\_in\_files() (in module loacore.load.review\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.load.review_load.load_reviews_in_files}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.load.review\_load.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{load\_reviews\_in\_files}}}{\emph{files}, \emph{load\_sentences=False}, \emph{load\_words=False}, \emph{load\_deptrees=False}}{}
Load \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}} s into corresponding \sphinxstyleemphasis{files}, setting up their attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{reviews}}.

Also return all the loaded reviews.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function is automatically called by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_load.load\_database()}} when \sphinxstyleemphasis{load\_reviews} is set to
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}. In most of the cases, this function should be used to load files and reviews in one go.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}) \textendash{} Files in which corresponding reviews will be loaded.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_sentences}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Specify if Sentences need to be loaded in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}} s.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_words}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If Sentences have been loaded, specify if Words need to be loaded in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_deptrees}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If Words have been loaded, specify if DepTrees need to be loaded in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}} s.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Loaded reviews

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}} s

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{load\_words\_in\_dep\_trees() (in module loacore.load.word\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.load.word_load.load_words_in_dep_trees}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.load.word\_load.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{load\_words\_in\_dep\_trees}}}{\emph{dep\_trees}, \emph{load\_lemmas=True}, \emph{load\_synsets=True}}{}
Load \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Word}} s into corresponding \sphinxstyleemphasis{dep\_trees}, setting up the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{word}} of each node.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function is automatically called by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_load.load\_database()}} when \sphinxstyleemphasis{load\_deptrees} is set to
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}, or by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dep\_tree.load\_deptrees()}} when \sphinxstyleemphasis{load\_words} is set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}.
In most of the cases, those functions should be used instead to load dep\_trees and words in one go.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dep\_trees}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DepTree}}) \textendash{} DepTrees in which corresponding words should be loaded.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_lemmas}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Specify if Lemmas need to be loaded in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Word}} s.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_synsets}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Specify if Synsets need to be loaded in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Word}} s.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{Sentiment Analysis}
\label{\detokenize{index:module-loacore.analysis.sentiment_analysis}}\label{\detokenize{index:sentiment-analysis}}\index{loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis (module)}\index{compute\_files\_polarity() (in module loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.analysis.sentiment_analysis.compute_files_polarity}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_files\_polarity}}}{\emph{files}}{}
Perform the easiest sentiment analysis possible : a normalized sum of the positive/negative/objective polarities
available in all synsets of each file.

Return a dictionnary that map file\_paths to a polarity tuple. A polarity tuple is a tuple of length 3, with this
form : (positive\_score, negative\_score, objective\_score)
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}) \textendash{} Files to process

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
IdFile/Scores dictionnary

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
\end{description}\end{quote}

Load all files and compute basic polarities

\section{Pattern Recognition}
\label{\detokenize{index:module-loacore.analysis.pattern_recognition}}\label{\detokenize{index:pattern-recognition}}\index{loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition (module)}
Patterns recognitions are realized on the dependency trees computed with Freeling. This means that \sphinxstyleemphasis{parent-child}
structures will be matched, what \sphinxstylestrong{don’t necessarily correspond to adjacent words in the original sentence}.
\index{general\_pattern\_recognition() (in module loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.analysis.pattern_recognition.general_pattern_recognition}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{general\_pattern\_recognition}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{pattern}, \emph{types}}{}
Recognize a general pattern, compound of PoS\_tags and dependency labels, in the DepTrees associated to specified
sentences.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of :obj{}`string{}`) \textendash{} A 2 dimensional list of strings representing patterns. The patterns list pattern{[}i{]} represents the label
that will match at position i. ex : \sphinxstyleemphasis{pattern = {[}{[}‘V’{]}, {[}‘cc’, ‘ci’, ‘cd’{]}{]}} will match all the
\sphinxstyleemphasis{Verb/complement} structures.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{types}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{string}}. Allowed value are ‘PoS\_tag’ and ‘label’. Otherwise, nothing will
match.) \textendash{} Specify what type of match to use, such that \sphinxstyleemphasis{types{[}i{]}} specifies if elements of \sphinxstyleemphasis{pattern{[}i{]}} have to be
condidered as PoS\_tag or label. Notice that types is unidimensional, whereas pattern can be 2 dimensional :
this means that for consistency reason, we assume that all the tags that can match in a position \sphinxstyleemphasis{i} are of
the same nature.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Matching patterns in specified sentences, as node tuples.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DepTreeNode}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Find all the Verb(PoS\_tag)/complement(label) patterns in file 28(\_PQRS.txt).

(classically, a negation that applies to the parent verb)

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\index{label\_patterns\_recognition() (in module loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.analysis.pattern_recognition.label_patterns_recognition}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{label\_patterns\_recognition}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{pattern}}{}
Recognize a dependency label pattern in the DepTrees associated to specified sentences.

Labels used for Spanish can be found there :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxurl{http://clic.ub.edu/corpus/webfm\_send/20}

\item {} 
\sphinxurl{http://clic.ub.edu/corpus/webfm\_send/18}

\item {} 
\sphinxurl{http://clic.ub.edu/corpus/webfm\_send/49}

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of :obj{}`string{}`) \textendash{} A 2 dimensional list of strings representing patterns. The patterns list pattern{[}i{]} represents the label that
will match at position i. ex : \sphinxstyleemphasis{pattern = {[}{[}‘sentence’, ‘v’{]}, {[}‘}’{]}{]}* could be used to find all the dependency
functions that could follow \sphinxstyleemphasis{sentence} of \sphinxstyleemphasis{v} function.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Matching patterns in specified sentences, as node tuples.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DepTreeNode}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Find all node to which a verbal modifier is applied in file 28 (\_PQRS.txt).

(classically, a negation that applies to the parent verb)

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{loacore}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{load}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{sentence\PYGZus{}load} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n+nn}{sentence\PYGZus{}load}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{pos\_tag\_patterns\_recognition() (in module loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:loacore.analysis.pattern_recognition.pos_tag_patterns_recognition}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{pos\_tag\_patterns\_recognition}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{pattern}}{}
Recognize a PoS\_tag pattern in the DepTrees associated to specified sentences.

PoS\_tags corresponding to each language can be found there :
\sphinxurl{https://talp-upc.gitbooks.io/freeling-4-1-user-manual/content/tagsets.html}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of :obj{}`string{}`) \textendash{} 
A 2 dimensional list of strings representing patterns. The patterns list pattern{[}i{]} represents the PoS\_tags that
will match at position i. ex : \sphinxstyleemphasis{pattern = {[}{[}‘V’{]}, {[}‘A’, ‘NC’{]}{]}} recognizes verbs followed by an adjective or a
common noun.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Matches are performed with the beginning of the PoS\_tag, according to the length of the specified
tags. For example, ‘A’ will match ‘AQ0CS00’, ‘AQ0MS00’…
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Matching patterns in specified sentences, as node tuples.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DepTreeNode}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Find all Noun/Adjective patterns in file 28 (\_PQRS.txt).

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{sentences} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sentence\PYGZus{}load}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{load\PYGZus{}sentences\PYGZus{}by\PYGZus{}id\PYGZus{}files}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{28}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}
